p: Most of the cost of an outbreak is not due to the pathogen itself, but due to the panic it causes. This is reflected in the fall in oil prices and the collapse of the stock markets. The WHO estimates that the expenses of this type of outbreak are approximately 40 billion euros (e.g. approximately 40 billion in 2003 for SARS and 40â€“50 billion for influenza A or H1N1 in 2009; Goodell, 2020).
